_meta.goal: Add many more REAL scholarships with zero duplicates

scholarships.name: Coca-Cola Scholars Program
scholarships.description: Achievement-based scholarship recognizing outstanding high school seniors who demonstrate leadership, service, and academic excellence. Awards range from $10,000 to $20,000.
scholarships.eligibility: High school seniors with minimum 3.0 GPA, demonstrated leadership and service, U.S. citizen/permanent resident

scholarships.name: Gates Scholarship
scholarships.description: A highly selective, full scholarship for exceptional, Pell-eligible, minority high school seniors. Covers the full cost of attendance not already covered by other financial aid.
scholarships.eligibility: High school seniors, Pell-eligible, minimum 3.3 GPA, from minority backgrounds

scholarships.name: Jack Kent Cooke Foundation College Scholarship
scholarships.description: Scholarships of up to $55,000 per year for high-achieving high school seniors with financial need. Covers four years of undergraduate study.
scholarships.eligibility: High school seniors with financial need, minimum 3.5 GPA, planning to attend accredited 4-year institution

scholarships.name: Dell Scholars Program
scholarships.description: Provides financial assistance and support services to students who have overcome significant obstacles. Recipients receive $20,000 scholarship, laptop, and textbook credits.
scholarships.eligibility: High school seniors participating in approved college readiness program, minimum 2.4 GPA, Pell-eligible

scholarships.name: Elks National Foundation Most Valuable Student
scholarships.description: Awards range from $4,000 to $50,000 distributed over four years for top high school seniors based on scholarship, leadership, and financial need.
scholarships.eligibility: High school seniors, U.S. citizens, financial need, leadership and scholarship

scholarships.name: Google Generation Scholarship
scholarships.description: Google's scholarship program to help aspiring computer scientists excel in technology and become leaders in the field. $10,000 for selected students.
scholarships.eligibility: Current university students pursuing computer science or related field, strong academic performance, demonstrated leadership

scholarships.name: QuestBridge National College Match
scholarships.description: Connects high-achieving, low-income students with full four-year scholarships to the nation's best colleges. Full-ride covering tuition, room, board, books, and travel.
scholarships.eligibility: High school seniors with outstanding academic ability and strong financial need, typically from households earning less than $65,000 annually

scholarships.name: AXA Achievement Scholarship
scholarships.description: Awards for students who have demonstrated ambition and drive, including self-direction and determination to succeed in college. 52 scholarships of $25,000 awarded.
scholarships.eligibility: High school seniors planning to attend accredited 2-year or 4-year college in the U.S., demonstrated ambition and drive

scholarships.name: Horatio Alger Scholarship
scholarships.description: For students who have faced and overcome great obstacles in their young lives. Awards range from $7,000 to $25,000.
scholarships.eligibility: High school seniors with critical financial need (less than $55,000 adjusted gross family income), demonstrated integrity and perseverance, minimum 2.0 GPA, U.S. citizen

scholarships.name: Davidson Fellows Scholarship
scholarships.description: Awards $50,000, $25,000, and $10,000 scholarships to students 18 or younger who have completed a significant piece of work in STEM, literature, music, or philosophy.
scholarships.eligibility: Students 18 or younger who have completed a significant piece of work

scholarships.name: Ron Brown Scholar Program
scholarships.description: Awarded to African-American high school seniors demonstrating academic excellence, exceptional leadership potential, community service, and financial need. $40,000 over four years.
scholarships.eligibility: African-American high school seniors, U.S. citizens or permanent residents, demonstrated academic achievement, financial need, leadership, and community service

scholarships.name: Amazon Future Engineer Scholarship
scholarships.description: Annual scholarship for students pursuing computer science degrees. Includes $40,000 ($10,000/year) scholarship and guaranteed summer internship at Amazon.
scholarships.eligibility: High school seniors from underrepresented or underserved communities planning to major in computer science, software engineering, computer engineering, or related field

scholarships.name: Burger King Scholars Program
scholarships.description: Scholarships ranging from $1,000 to $50,000 for high school seniors who have a minimum 2.5 GPA, plan to enroll full-time, participate in community service, and work part-time.
scholarships.eligibility: High school seniors, minimum 2.5 GPA, U.S. or Canadian residents, planning to enroll full-time at accredited institution

scholarships.name: Hispanic Scholarship Fund
scholarships.description: Supporting Hispanic students with scholarships ranging from $500 to $5,000. Over $40 million awarded annually to students pursuing higher education.
scholarships.eligibility: Students of Hispanic heritage, minimum 3.0 GPA for high school students, minimum 2.5 GPA for college/graduate students, U.S. citizen, permanent resident, or DACA

scholarships.name: UNCF Scholarships
scholarships.description: The United Negro College Fund provides scholarships to African-American students attending UNCF member institutions and other accredited colleges. Various amounts available.
scholarships.eligibility: African-American students with minimum 2.5 GPA, financial need, U.S. citizen or permanent resident
